result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elisha Yusef Colas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Elisha Yusef Colas in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Elisha Yusef Colas in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Elisha Yusef Colas not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24 is in trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Elisha Yusef Colas not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The deputy is not able to produce the defendant at this time due to his custody status.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court ordered bail modified.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Elisha Yusef Colas in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case called at 11:45 am.  The Court advised the parties that we will not be able to proceed with the sentencing hearing until 1:30 pm.  The defendant has outstanding warrants.  The defendant was taken into custody and case was passed until 1:30 pm.

Defendant Elisha Yusef Colas in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  The defendant was referred to the Public Defender's office.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
